We didn’t care for this one.  Maybe it was the particular exhibits, but for such a large museum, there wasn’t much to see.  The particular exhibits (sound and color) we saw we very poor quality.  There were a lot of hands on activities for children which we do not have.

This is an excellent museum with lots of interesting exhibits. Well displayed in a very professional atmosphere. Courteous helpful staff. Worth checking out. Recommend taking the time to check this place out.
This is a great place to visit, nice exhibits and educational. i would reccommend this to couples...

Our day started with clouds and did turn to raindrops so when that happened we decided to stay on the Riverfront and visit the Irene Pennington Planetarium in the Art and Science Museum. We were there in time for the 2PM show about the Apollo. We had missed the official 50th anniversary activities so this was a good celebration of accomplishment for us. It was a big WOW to see the documentary, including the moon landing and subsequent walk on the moon,in the planetarium rather than on TV. There is also a small interactive exhibit area before you go up to the planetarium. Staff were very welcoming. We did not see the art exhibits, but you might want to save time for that depending on your interests.

Some nice things in the museum and in general had fun. Really was disappointed in the actual planetarium. It was Dino weekend so very geared to young kids.  Wanted our older ones to learn things in the planetarium and felt it was a lost opportunity. Would have liked to learn things from Hubble for example. Lots of opportunity that I felt was missed. But the exhibits were interesting and enjoyed the hands on exhibits.

name: Burden Museum & Gardens
reviews: heart The Burden facility is a delightful experience from the beautiful plants and schrubs to the antiques to take you back to yesteryear and right in the heart of Bato Rouge
Spent the day there @ a wedding -- lovely, lovely -- grounds are fantastic-- lots to see and do for for a family or couple -- brig a picnic lunch and enjoy the day

This is one of the best outdoor/indoor museums in the country.  It is a hidden gem.  The property contains and Overseers home, slave cabins, an outdoor kitchen, sugar cane processing, black smith's shop, and much more.  The indoor museum has artifacts from the early 18C to the Industrial Revolution.  This is a must see visit.

We found this green space with such easy access to the interstate to be a welcomed respite from car travel. The trails are for the most part shaded in the early afternoon but prepare because this is Louisiana in July. Take your water and wear good shoes because the trail is gravel and sand not paved. We explored the native flora and fauna and easily spent 1 1/2 hours hiking. There are gardens, a visitor’s center and agricultural museum but alas we had no time to see them. No fees! Easy parking! Hike away!

I love to go there and see the roses, and walk through the grounds behind the house.  The museum is interesting and has different activities at different times of the year.  Worth the trip to get outdoors and enjoy a peaceful walk and see the mature gardens that have been tended over the years.

We found this green space with such easy access to the interstate to be a welcomed respite from car travel. The trails are for the most part shaded in the early afternoon but prepare because this is Louisiana in July. Take your water and wear good shoes because the trail is gravel and sand not paved. We explored the native flora and fauna and easily spent 1 1/2 hours hiking. There are gardens, a visitor’s center and agricultural museum but alas we had no time to see them. No fees! Easy parking! Hike away!
Beloved yearly special events. Beautiful well kept grounds year round. A must see for lovers of south Louisiana history.
heart The Burden facility is a delightful experience from the beautiful plants and schrubs to the antiques to take you back to yesteryear and right in the heart of Bato Rouge
Spent the day there @ a wedding -- lovely, lovely -- grounds are fantastic-- lots to see and do for for a family or couple -- brig a picnic lunch and enjoy the day

The garden's have several distinct areas. The rose garden had been affected by the heat, but the tropical gardens were loving every humid degree. The New Guinea impatiens were beautiful, The children;s gardens included climbers for extra fun. There is a tree and woods hiking trail, but the warm humid day made us decide to put that off until another day, There is also a visitor's center. The LSU Rural Life Museum is in another section of the property so there is plenty to keep a visitor busy for a day.

We were more interested in the nature trails and didn't visit the museum. The trails were hot due to mostly non-shaded paths compared to the Bluebonnet Nature Center (Which we adored - heavily shaded and well maintained paths). Our children much preferred the latter. The close proximity to the highway was also a disadvantage as the road noise was pretty loud. We did enjoy reading each sign identifying trees/plants and the flower/rose garden which were misting at the time. Our kids enjoyed the cool down (age 4 & 7). The children's play area up front was well kept with adorable playground equipment.

name: Red Stick Farmers Market
reviews: This is a really decent Farmers Market that pops up in the middle of the business district on Saturday mornings. It's a very interactive experience with lots of new things to taste, smell, touch and see. Reasonably priced vendors, high quality offerings, easy to park and walk to. Good for when the weather is nice. Even if you don't want to buy, it's an enjoyable experience whether alone, with friends or kids.

This is a really decent Farmers Market that pops up in the middle of the business district on Saturday mornings. It's a very interactive experience with lots of new things to taste, smell, touch and see. Reasonably priced vendors, high quality offerings, easy to park and walk to. Good for when the weather is nice. Even if you don't want to buy, it's an enjoyable experience whether alone, with friends or kids.

We like to support local people.  Great for a nice morning walk and to get some fresh vegetables and produce. Bought some local sausage and soups that were delicious. You can spend a nice relaxing morning on the weekend. Great way to start the day.

Pleasantly surprised by the quality of vendors, the variety of offerings and the kindness of the people! We’ve been to a few markets, and this one is definitely one of the better ones!
Be sure to check out the mushroom stand!
Visited the Farmers Market Saturday morning.  An exceptional offering of fruits, vegetables, breads, pies, meats.  Something for everyone!

A weekly exclamation of some of the best of Baton Rouge local produce, seafood, and plants in a lively community setting on Main Street downtown. The market is open year-round on Saturday mornings. A complement of nearby cafes and restaurants to enjoy.

We like to support local people.  Great for a nice morning walk and to get some fresh vegetables and produce. Bought some local sausage and soups that were delicious. You can spend a nice relaxing morning on the weekend. Great way to start the day.

Plenty of offerings today--plants, nuts, veggies, dairy, eggs, lamb, homwmade sweets, local honey. Pleasant merchants. Strawberries are delicious!   Plus a walk around downtown Baton Rouge. Enjoyable.

name: Theater Baton Rouge
reviews: This small theater in downtown Baton Rouge is a true gem. Great seating, beautiful decor and dynamite sound system make this theater a stellar venue for small concerts and plays.

First time at this big little theatre.  Comfortable, spacious with a bar for libations before the show!  A well done production of Silent Sky a true story rendition of women in Astronomy.....the heady days of wonder, excitement and discovery! Play was well written, clever and well acted.  I highly recommend a show here.
Excellent production. Superb cast and direction. Go see this musical. Voices are outstanding and orchestra and ensemble blend well together. Dana Todd Lux in supporting role is as good as it gets.

Just saw Cabaret.  It was fantastic.  The production is always on point.  Every seat is a good seat.  Small bar at the front.  Place is a little dated but it really adds to the atmosphere.  Been going to plays here for two years and after this last play, we have signed up for season tickets!!!  If you need a great date night idea, you can't go wrong.
The production of "Cabaret" was first class, off the chart good. Thank you to TBR for this latest effort! I can only say "Wow" and congratulations to all involved!

name: University Lake
reviews: Great place for daily walks/jogs/bike rides.  The scenery is breathtaking and the houses you pass by are stunning.  The trail is well maintained and marked.
Algae has taken over this lake. Now it looks disgusting. I will not go kayaking here until they clean this area up.
THE walk around the university LSU lakes is senic and always has others enjoying the views and exercise. You can also visit the campus and neighboring resturants.
At different times of the year, the lakes are home to migrating white pelicans by the hundreds and 10 foot pink flamingos(silhouettes to celebrate Madrid Gras).

University Lake is a wonderful place to walk, jog or bike, however, it is congested and sadly there are no bike or pedestrian paths.  The bikers tend to be very aggressive so if on foot be careful.  But is still is a great place to go exercise, enjoy indigenous Louisiana swamp life, beautiful architecture, LSU, the lake,  and simply enjoy outdoor life.  It really is a gem in our city.  The lake is fun for couples, families, friends and solo

name: Arsenal Park
reviews: What a wonderful walking park! There were lots of interesting things to read and learn about... many things to make you walk just a little further...
This is a  old brick  fort  this part of the legislative grounds. You can have the opportunity to walk around and walk inside.
This place is always fun to get out and walk around. You can even see the State Capital and take some great shots with your camera. I recommend this place.
We had a very nice walk around the park and along the lake. Very nice views. You can also see the governor's mansion if you cross the bridge.

Went on a Saturday and the museum was supposed to be open but it wasn't so don't know what was up with that.  Bicyclists and joggers were running around the park.  Nice view of Capitol Lakes from the Indian Mound.   No flowers, just green trees but nice to walk around.
